data.title: Absolutely delicious and fresh, creative meals
data.text: I have been here a few times and it never fails that the food is beyond fantastic!  Make sure to check their menu before you go on Facebook, because their menu is small but again, delicious!  It is a very quaint and open, modern place and perfectly sitting in up and coming downtown Rogers.

data.title: Excellent Local Cuisine and a Unique Dining Experience
data.text: For our anniversary I decided to get the necessary dinner reservations 3 months in advance as a surprise for my wife...and it was well worth the forethought. The only decision to be made when you arrive is which wine to have with your meal. Chef Jason, Danielle and company are very welcoming and helpful for the entire evening, as the small location seats less than two dozen and there is only one meal service. So settle in for a memorable 3-hour experience discovering what Chef has created, using seasonal local ingredients. If you enjoy fresh, imaginative food you will be enthralled. We look forward to visiting again as soon as possible!

data.title: Valentines day dinner was  a wonderful experience
data.text: We were lucky enough to get a reserveration for one of the 3 nights they were offering a 8 course dinner for Valentines day.  Chef Jason did not dissapoint at all, every course was fantastic starting with the glass of Champagne that we were greated with till the final dessert course. Chef is an artist with a blank canvas.  Tastes, textures were amazing in every course.  My favorites for the night were the Charcol Tempura Cod with Braised Bok Choy and the Winter Citrus, Shaved Fennel, Dried Olives and herbs.  As always the service is top notch.  Cant wait till our next visit

data.title: FANTASTIC food!  Very limited menu but very high quality!
data.text: We had lunch during weekday.  The food was excellent.  Very limited menu that changes daily (only offered one sandwich, soup and salad.  The food was excellent! Everything prepared in house fresh and delicious!  Highly recommend!  Lunch is very reasonable priced but dinner is pricey.  Dinner by Reservation ONLY.

data.title: It was okay
data.text: Expensive, small portions and a long wait. The food was good, but overpriced. Not somewhere I would go regularly. Definitely not enough time to go on your work lunch hour, unless you've got a couple hours.

data.title: Fantastic gem in Rogers
data.text: I hadn't heard about Heirloom until a few weeks before friends brought us there. Tough to get a reservation for dinner but well worth the wait.  Great food (you get whatever they are serving so be aware for picky eaters) and the staff are very attentive. Best dinning experience have had in NWA

data.title: Not much selection
data.text: My husband didn't like salad at all but my sandwich was pretty good. My sandwich was a mushroom mozzarella squash mayo sandwich

data.title: Delicious, healthy lunch
data.text:
Stopped in for lunch while driving thru NW AR.  Restaurant is located in downtown Rogers on a street paved with brick, quaint.   Inside, the restaurant's decor is somewhat industrial, somewhat eclectic.  Plates, glasses, silverware are a disparate mix, perhaps from local thrift stores.  Wait staff and chef were friendly and attentive.  We enjoyed an avocado toast appetizer topped with goat cheese and sunflower seeds.  Then selected a sampler plate of the daily soup, salad and sandwich.  The salad consisted of hand massaged kale, carrots, chick peas, candied walnuts topped with a perfect yogurt dressing.  Sandwich was buffalo heirloom cauliflower accompanied by 
blue cheese and aiole on a light French roll.  Apple cider oven roasted butternut squash soup rounded out a perfectly delightful lunch.  Menu was limited to these few items, written on a chalk board, and changes daily.  This is vegetarian week.  We look forward to returning !

data.title: Best meal ever!
data.text: Sure do love this little gem and I bet you will too! Try their lunch one day Tuesday-Thursday. Then make reservations 1 month out for a fantastic dinner with your friends and family, it's totally worth the wait! You could also have a private party, which is what we love doing. Each time we visit is a different experience and each time we love it that much more. Melt in your mouth flavor with healthy options and yummy desert!

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text: I'm not a "foodie" so I was a little skeptical of this place. Turns out I had no reason to be! Amazing food, good portions, great service.  I'll be back!!

data.title: " Heirloom After Dark" is a must exeperience
data.text:
We have eaten lunch there many times and have been lucky enough to have enjoyed thier "After Dinner Dark" dinners on a few occasions.  Because of Trip Advisor rules this is the first time I have had the opportunity to write a review for our dinner experience.  This is Chef Jason's stage to let his creativity shine with what is currenty in season locally. And shine he does!!!!  Everything is made from scratch and each course is a treat. Reservations are a must as they currently are only doing dinner on Friday's and Saturdays so call NOW for future. Usually about mid week the dinner menu is posted on thier facebook page and it changes weekly!   It is a Prixe Fix menu and each of the tables is only seated once during the evening so you are not rushed and what is brought to the table for each course was just prepared. The service is excellent, friendly and you can tell they enjoy thier patrons. We enjoy them just as much.  You can bring your own wine for a $15 Corkage fee per bottle but they have been adding to thier own selection ongoing.  Easy to see why this is the #1 restaurant in Rogers but as far as I am concerned they are #1 in NWA.   We are looking foward to our next dining experience.
Congrats to Chef Jason and his team!

data.title: Everything was great!
data.text: All of us ordered the sampler. A cup of wonderful light tomato, pepper soup. Pear, arugula, walnut salad. Sandwich was warm light ciabatta bread, fresh mozzarella, tomatoe, tempura zucchini and herb mayonnaise.  It was wonderful!

data.title: Celebrity Chef in the making
data.text:
Wow, Heirloom is my favorite place to take someone new to NWA. Everything is made from scratch and beyond wonderful. We certainly are fortunate to have a celebrity chef in the making.

Lunch is where you get in, unless you book now for a few months out, it's sort of a pop-up style menu and it's so good, you basically have to get lucky or make plans a few months out to treat yourself. Extensive wine menu and culinary culture, my favorite funky fun foddie kink of place!

data.title: Something light and fresh for lunch
data.text:
First time visiting this quaint little boutique restaurant in downtown Rogers. Initially was not sure about the limited menu - one soup, sandwich, salad and side to choose from, BUT flavor and quality exceeded my expectations.
Food very flavorful and presented very artistically. Thoroughly enjoyed and almost licked the plate clean.
Fare is light, which is probably a good thing, as we were saving room anyway to dessert at the local cupcake shop.
Worth trying!!! We will be back.

data.title: Love this unique place!
data.text:
What a wonderful lunch!  Get the sampler so you taste everything!
I loved the half- sandwich, the salad, and the soup!
Their homemade vanilla cheesecake ice cream was a perfect ending to an outstanding meal!

data.title: OH MY!!! GO ASAP!
data.text: What a delightful addition to NWA dining and downtown Rogers. Seating limited to 20, usually booked 3 weeks out, but plan ahead and go. One seating, between 6:30-7:15pm. Chef Jason picks the dinner menu based on local fresh options. (Same menu Fri/Sat $40 p/p the night we were there) based on local fresh options. Your tastebuds will pop with the surprising combination of favors. He or Danielle visited our table with each course (6) to describe the ingredients. Nice sized servings, attentive staff. We were there over 2 hours. It's an event, not a "before a movie" rush job.

data.title: perfect ladies lunch spot!
data.text: As other reviewers have mentioned, the space is small.  But we went at 12:30 on a Tues. and had no problems getting in.  The menu is sparse:  1 sandwich, 1 salad, and soup.  They also had "the sampler" (half of each of the above) for $13.50 I think, which is what we all had.  Everything was absolutely delicious, and while I might have liked a bit bigger servings, it was probably just what I needed.  They closed at 2:00 and at about 1:20 we were the only ones left, so we felt compelled to quit chatting and leave.  Very attentive wait staff and chef as well.

data.title: Seasonal and delicious!
data.text: Had a delicious sandwich and salad - all vegetarian. The soup that day looked great, and my friend said it was tasty, but I didn't try ti because it wasn't vegetarian. Small space, family seating, and you can see the chef work from a number of seats. Great service and delicious, seasonal food made from fresh ingredients. We went early because we were told they often sell out of food. However, it wasn't very crowded, probably because it was a rainy day. Highly recommended.

data.title: A gem in downtown rogers.
data.text: I recently had lunch here and was so impressed with the quality of the food and the service, I cannot wait to go back. The food is fresh and flavorful, the setting is intimate. The wait staff was so attentive I never had to ask for a refill on my drink. I love that the menu changes based on what produce is available.

data.title: Amazing find!
data.text: Delicious and delightful lunch in downtown Rogers!  Very simple menu -- one soup, one salad, one sandwich offered on a chalkboard menu.  Everything is fresh and freshly cooked/prepared.  Service was great! I think our server was also an owner.  The cook/chef came out to talk with us and make sure we were enjoying our lunch.  And we were enjoying and savoring every bite!  As mentioned by other reviewers, the small, unpretentious restaurant has an "urban vibe" that is quite unexpected but also quite pleasant.
